etymology.description: 白(白) (bái, "spring mouth") + 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") = water flowing from the source of a spring -> spring
etymology.interpretation: The character 泉(泉) (quán, "spring") combines 白(白) (bái, "spring mouth") and 水(水) (shuǐ, "water") to represent water emerging from a spring's source, intuitively depicting the concept of a natural water spring.

examples.chinese: 古泉涓涓而流(古泉涓涓而流)。
山谷中藏着泉水(山谷中藏著泉水)，滋润了大地(滋潤了大地)。
examples.pinyin: shāngǔ zhōng cángzhe quánshuǐ，zīrùn le dàdì。
examples.english: A spring is hidden in the valley, nurturing the earth.
